\end{verbatim}

\begin{figure}[H]

{\centering \includegraphics{drone_sentiment_files/figure-pdf/word-ratio-1.pdf}

}

\end{figure}

The difference in word frequency represents the percentage of the
difference between the words used. For example, ``good'' is featured 8\%
more frequently in supportive votes than in opposing ones. On the other
hand, ``war'' and ``weapon'' are featured more frequently in opposing
votes.

The reason the word frequencies for supporters peak much more than for
people opposing drone exports is because opposing viewpoints tended to
use a greater variety of language, whereas drone export supporters
mostly used the same words like ``good'', ``country'' and ``ally''.
